column1: Heading and intro text on Employment Statement section use incorrect labels
column26:
The *â€œEmployment Application Recordsâ€* page does not align with the expected copy and structure defined in the user story and design wireframe for the *Employment Statement â†’ Job Search Efforts* section of VA Form 21-8940.

According to the user story and wireframe:

* The *Page Title* should display: *â€œEmployment Statementâ€ (Page title should always be section header name)*
* The *Section Header* should display: *â€œJob Search Effortsâ€*
* The *Introductory text* should display:
â€œTell us about your job search efforts.â€

In the current implementation:

* The *Page Title* incorrectly displays: *â€œEmployment Application Recordsâ€*
* The *Section Header* incorrectly displays: *â€œLeaving Your Last Position.â€*
* The *Introductory text* is missing or inconsistent with the expected phrasing.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *VA Form 21-8940 > Employment Statement* section.
# Proceed to the screen that asks:
_â€œHave you tried to obtain employment since you became too disabled to work?â€_
# Observe the displayed page title, section header, and introductory text.

*Expected Behavior:*
Per design and acceptance criteria:

* *Page Title:* _Employment Statement_
* *Section Header:* _Job Search Efforts_
* *Introductory Text:* _Tell us about your job search efforts._
* *Primary Question:* _Have you tried to obtain employment since you became too disabled to work?_

*Actual Behavior:*

* Page Title displays *â€œEmployment Application Records.â€*
* Section Header displays *â€œLeaving Your Last Position.â€*
* Introductory text does not match expected wording.

column1: "Time Lost from Illness" label should use sentence case formatting
column26:
The label text for the *â€œTime Lost from Illness (number of days lost)â€* field is incorrectly capitalized.
Currently, each word is capitalized (â€œTime Lost from Illnessâ€), but per [http://VA.gov|http://VA.gov|smart-link]  style standards, only the first word should be capitalized unless referencing a proper noun.

The label should read:
*Time lost from illness (number of days lost)*

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Employment Details* section of VA Form 21-8940.
# Scroll to the input field labeled *â€œTime Lost from Illness (number of days lost)â€*.
# Observe capitalization in the field label.

*Expected Behavior:*

* Label follows sentence-style capitalization:
*â€œTime lost from illness (number of days lost)â€*

*Actual Behavior:*

* Label displays title-style capitalization:
*â€œTime Lost from Illness (number of days lost)â€*

*Impact:*

* Introduces minor UI inconsistency.



!image-20251106-212037.png|width=595,alt="image-20251106-212037.png"!

column1: "Before Becoming Disabled" question selection auto-populates the After Becoming Disabled question
column26:
When a user selects *Yes* or *No* on the _â€˜Education and Training Before Becoming Disabledâ€™_ question (Page 9 of 13), that same response automatically appears selected on the _â€˜Education and Training After Becoming Disabledâ€™_ question (Page 10 of 13).

These are two separate questions and should be treated independently. The selection from one should not affect the other.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Page 9 of 13  â€“ Education and Training Before Becoming Disabled.*
# Select either *Yes* or *No* for â€œDid you have any other education and training before you were too disabled to work?â€
# Click *Continue* to advance to *Page 10 of 13 â€“ Education and Training After Becoming Disabled.*
# Observe that the same answer automatically appears selected for the â€œAfterâ€ question.

*Expected Behavior:*

* The â€œAfter Becoming Disabledâ€ question should load with *no pre-selected response* unless the user explicitly selects one.
* The â€œBeforeâ€ and â€œAfterâ€ questions should be *independent data fields.*

*Actual Behavior:*

* The â€œAfter Becoming Disabledâ€ question auto-populates with the same answer (Yes/No) selected on the â€œBefore Becoming Disabledâ€ screen.

*Impact:*

* User responses may be inaccurate if they overlook the pre-filled selection.
* Can lead to incorrect data submission and confusion during form completion.

column1: (Form 21-8940) "Street2," "Street3," "City," and "State" field labels are incorrectly lowercase on Hospital Information screen
column26:
On the *Hospital Information* screen, the address field labels â€” â€œstreet2,â€ â€œstreet3,â€ â€œcity,â€ and â€œstateâ€ â€” are displayed in lowercase.

All form field labels should begin with a capital letter for consistency and accessibility alignment with VA design standards.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Hospital Information* screen.
# Observe the field labels below *â€œStreet address.â€*

h3. *Actual Result:*

* The following field labels appear in lowercase:
** â€œstreet2â€
** â€œstreet3â€
** â€œcityâ€
** â€œstateâ€

h3. *Expected Result:*

* Field labels should follow consistent capitalization with other form labels:
** â€œStreet 2â€
** â€œStreet 3â€
** â€œCityâ€
** â€œStateâ€

column55: BIO Forms Front End Dev Team

column1: (Form 21-8940) Year field accepts non-digit input on â€œPeak Earnings page
column26:
On the *Peak Earnings* screen of VA Form 21-4140, the *â€œWhat year did you make your peak earnings?â€* field allows the user to proceed after entering a two-digit year (e.g., â€œ25â€).

Expected behavior is that the field should require *a 4-digit year format (e.g., 2025)* before allowing the user to continue.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Peak Earnings* screen.
# Enter a valid numeric value for â€œWhat is the most you ever earned in one year?â€
# Enter only *two digits* (e.g., â€œ25â€) in the *â€œWhat year did you make your peak earnings?â€* field.
# Complete the remaining required fields.
# Click *Continue*.

h3. *Actual Result:*

* The form allows the user to continue with only a *two-digit year* (e.g., â€œ25â€).
* No validation error is displayed.

h3. *Expected Result:*

* The *year field* should require a *four-digit year format (e.g., 2025)*.
* Validation message should display for invalid entries:
â€œPlease enter a valid 4-digit year.â€

column55: BIO Forms Front End Dev Team

column1: (Form 21-8940) Incorrect screen sequence What You Need to Get Started appears before Let's get started
column26:
*Description:*
The â€œWhat You Need to Get Startedâ€ screen is currently appearing *before* the â€œLetâ€™s get startedâ€ screen.
This screen should display *after* both â€œLetâ€™s get startedâ€ and â€œImportant Information Before You Start,â€ and immediately before Section I.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Launch the VA Form 21-8940 online form.
# Begin navigating through the initial screens.
# Observe that â€œWhat You Need to Get Startedâ€ appears before â€œLetâ€™s get started.â€

*Expected Behavior:*
The correct screen sequence should be:

# Application introduction (landing page)
# Letâ€™s get started
# Important Information Before You Start
# *What You Need to Get Started*
# Section I â€“ Veteran Identification Information

*Actual Behavior:*
â€œWhat You Need to Get Startedâ€ appears before â€œLetâ€™s get started.â€

*Impact / Severity:*
Medium-High. Users see the checklist prior to confirming that they are on the correct form, potentially causing confusion and extra navigation.

column1: Incorrect screen sequence - Important Information Before You Start appears before Let's get started
column26:
The Important Information Before You Start page is currently appearing *before* the â€œLetâ€™s get startedâ€ screen in the VA Form 21-8940 flow.
Per design and content order on the wireframe design, this page must display *after* the â€œLetâ€™s get startedâ€ screen and *before* the â€œWhat You Need to Get Startedâ€ checklist.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Launch the VA Form 21-8940 online form.
# Begin the flow and observe the initial screens presented.
# Note that the â€œImportant Information Before You Startâ€ page is displayed *before* â€œLetâ€™s get started.â€

*Expected Behavior:*
The correct screen sequence should be:

# Application introduction (landing page)
# Letâ€™s get started
# *Important Information Before You Start*
# What You Need to Get Started
# Section I â€“ Veteran Identification Information

*Actual Behavior:*
â€œImportant Information Before You Startâ€ displays *before* â€œLetâ€™s get started.â€

*Impact / Severity:*
Medium-High. The incorrect sequence introduces confusion by presenting instructional content before confirming that the user is on the correct form.
